topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Cold open advice on staying close to market talent, followed by Lenny’s intro of Lauren and what the episode will cover (hiring, candidate strategy, recruiter mistakes).

topics.title: Sponsor Break: Retool and Miro
topics.summary: Lenny reads sponsor messages for Retool (internal tools) and Miro (visual collaboration/whiteboarding).

topics.title: Lauren’s career path into executive search
topics.summary: Lauren shares her path from broadcast journalism to executive recruiting, her time at Daversa Partners, an in-house recruiting stint, and her move to General Catalyst focusing on consumer and crypto.

topics.title: Why top recruiters are moving to VC
topics.summary: They discuss why recruiters increasingly join venture funds: volatility and hustle in agency search, risk in-house, and the timing/stability tradeoffs (not primarily comp-driven).

topics.title: Common founder mistake: chasing big-name CPOs
topics.summary: Lauren explains why early-stage founders often over-index on “shiny” big-company executives who may be far from hands-on work; better to hire someone closer to execution with room to grow.

topics.title: Defining the role: mandate, success, and org design
topics.summary: Advice on getting granular about what outcome the hire should drive, what success looks like at 90 days/1 year/2 years, and avoiding “hire a head of product because the board said so.”

topics.title: Product leader archetypes and avoiding unicorn roles
topics.summary: Lauren outlines common buckets (platform/infrastructure, core/consumer, design/UX, plus specialists like growth/monetization) and warns against trying to hire one person to do everything.

topics.title: Titles: Head of Product vs VP vs CPO
topics.summary: They unpack how titles vary by stage and why early startups often avoid C-level titles; “head of” can still mean top leader, but layering later is common as needs change.

topics.title: Planting seeds early: market pulse and advisory chats
topics.summary: Founders should keep a running pulse on great companies and leaders, do no-agenda conversations, and involve strong candidates as advisors before a formal role exists.

topics.title: Time investment and high-leverage sourcing tactics
topics.summary: Lauren argues it’s less about hours and more about impact: use trusted networks, warm intros, and differentiated outreach rather than only cold LinkedIn; also leverage investors/boards for targeting.

topics.title: Favorite placement story and what great looks like
topics.summary: Lauren shares her favorite hire (VP Engineering at IRL), why he was exceptional (technical + high EQ), and how long courtship and trust-building can land standout leaders.

topics.title: Sponsor Break: Vanta
topics.summary: Lenny reads a sponsor message for Vanta, focusing on SOC 2 compliance automation and a listener discount.

topics.title: PM career strategy: breadth, market awareness, and moves
topics.summary: From the candidate side, Lauren emphasizes building breadth across product areas, staying aware of market options even when happy, avoiding logo-collecting, and ensuring you can point to real impact and strong references.
